text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition ext-R5-Consent.provision

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Extension 0..*ExtensionConstraints to the base Consent.policyRule/Consent.policy
Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Closed by value:url
extension:period 0..1ExtensionTimeframe for this provision
value[x] 0..1PeriodTimeframe for this provision
extension:actor 0..*ExtensionWho|what controlled by this provision (or group, by role)
Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Closed by value:url
extension:role 0..1ExtensionHow the actor is involved
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptHow the actor is involved
Binding: ParticipationRoleType (extensible): How an actor is involved in the consent considerations.
extension:reference 0..1ExtensionResource for the actor (or group, by role)
value[x] 0..1Reference(Device | Group | CareTeam | Organization | Patient | Practitioner | RelatedPerson | PractitionerRole)Resource for the actor (or group, by role)
extension:action 0..*ExtensionActions controlled by this provision
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptActions controlled by this provision
Binding: ConsentActionCodes (example): Detailed codes for the consent action.
extension:securityLabel 0..*ExtensionSecurity Labels that define affected resources
value[x] 0..1CodingSecurity Labels that define affected resources
Binding: security-label-examples (??) (example): Example Security Labels from the Healthcare Privacy and Security Classification System.
extension:purpose 0..*ExtensionContext of activities covered by this provision
value[x] 0..1CodingContext of activities covered by this provision
Binding: PurposeOfUse (extensible): What purposes of use are controlled by this exception. If more than one label is specified, operations must have all the specified labels.
extension:documentType 0..*Extensione.g. Resource Type, Profile, CDA, etc
value[x] 0..1Codinge.g. Resource Type, Profile, CDA, etc
Binding: ConsentContentClass (preferred): The document type a consent provision covers.
extension:resourceType 0..*Extensione.g. Resource Type, Profile, etc
value[x] 0..1Codinge.g. Resource Type, Profile, etc
Binding: Cross-version VS for R5.ResourceType for use in FHIR R4 (extensible): The resource types a consent provision covers.
extension:code 0..*Extensione.g. LOINC or SNOMED CT code, etc. in the content
value[x] 0..1CodeableConcepte.g. LOINC or SNOMED CT code, etc. in the content
Binding: ConsentContentCodes (example): If this code is found in an instance, then the exception applies.
extension:dataPeriod 0..1ExtensionTimeframe for data controlled by this provision
value[x] 0..1PeriodTimeframe for data controlled by this provision
extension:data 0..*ExtensionData controlled by this provision
Slices for extension 2..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Closed by value:url
extension:meaning 1..1Extensioninstance | related | dependents | authoredby
value[x] 0..1codeinstance | related | dependents | authoredby
Binding: consent-data-meaning|5.0.0 (??) (required): How a resource reference is interpreted when testing consent restrictions.
extension:reference 1..1ExtensionThe actual data reference
value[x] 0..1Reference(Resource)The actual data reference
extension:expression 0..1ExtensionA computable expression of the consent
value[x] 0..1ExpressionA computable expression of the consent
extension:provision 0..*ExtensionNested Exception Provisions
Slices for extension Content/Rules for all slices
extension:_datatype 0..1(Complex)Data type name for Consent.provision.provision from FHIR R5
URL: http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/_datatype
value[x] 1..1stringValue of extension
Fixed Value: Consent.provision
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Consent.provision"

Documentation for this format

name: ext_R5_Consent_provision
title: Cross-version Extension for R5.Consent.provision for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents Consent.provision from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Consent|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.definition: An exception to the base policy of this consent. An exception can be an addition or removal of access permissions.
element.comment: `Consent.provision` maps to R4 `Consent.provision`. So is mapped as Equivalent.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.definition: An exception to the base policy of this consent. An exception can be an addition or removal of access permissions.
